item.title: Seamless Windows Applications in Linux
item.description: Introduction One frustration that every Linux user has experienced is when you need to run a particular program that is only available for Windows. While for the overwhelming majority of applications there are equivalent solutions in Linux, sometimes the native Windows application is just what you need to use. Whether it is because your professional workflow requires you to use it or the equivalent solutions are just not nearly as powerful as the original (looking at you Excel), there are times where your use case demands the Windows program.
